AVSEC Order No.  26 /2011 
Subject:- 
Security control of  departing  passengers  holding  E-ticket/Web or 
Kiosk Check-in Boarding Pass  
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act 1934, 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation, Notification 
No.1797 dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security(Civil Aviation), for the 
purpose of  securing the aircraft operations and access  control at the  civil  airports 
in India directs that:- 
1. E-tickets : 
 
1.1 
Passengers with confirmed e-tickets or web boarding pass shall be 
allowed access into the departure terminal only after the authenticity of          
e-ticket or web boarding pass and genuineness of its holder is established at 
the access control point of the terminal building. For this purpose, passengers 
concerned shall produce a valid photo identity document (passport in case of 
International pax) before being allowed to enter the Terminal Building;   
 
1.2 
Passengers shall be responsible to carry reliable identity proof with 
them throughout the journey for checking at any point of time. The instructions 
to passengers shall be printed prominently on the e-tickets regarding proof of 
identity; 
 
2. Web/Kiosk- self check-in boarding pass: 
 
2.1 
Web or Kiosk boarding Pass shall have all the features like present 
boarding pass in vogue to avoid any confusion during check by the 
ASG/APSU. 2D Bar Code on the Web or Kiosk check-in Boarding Pass shall 
be mandatory to prevent duplication/forgery. 
 
3. Boarding an aircraft:
2:
3.1 
Passengers with Kiosk generated boarding cards will not be required to 
report to the airlines check-in counter and may proceed directly for security 
check if they have no hold baggage. 
 
Contd…2

3.2 
No passenger shall be allowed by the aircraft operator concerned to 
board the aircraft unless bona fide of the passenger holding web or kiosk 
check-in boarding pass is established through valid photo identity documents 
at the boarding gate. Aircraft operators shall incorporate this requirement in 
their security programme. In case of any dereliction or violation, strict 
departmental action shall automatically be taken against the staff by the 
aircraft operator concerned, in addition to legal action required. 
 
4. Safeguard : 
 
4.1 
Aircraft operators concerned shall devise means to prevent any 
alteration or unauthorised duplicity of the booked E-tickets, Web/Kiosk check-
in boarding pass.  
 
4.2 
Person or Passenger detected with forgery of travel documents shall 
be handed over to Police for legal action. 
 
4.3 
Kiosk check-in Boarding Pass shall bear water marks (name of airport) 
on it. 
 
5. Training requirement: 
 
5.1 
Training to all the staff concerned for implementation of the above 
mentioned procedure shall be organized by the airport operators in coordination 
with CISF/ASG, APSU and airlines. 
6. Coming into force: 
6.1 
This AVSEC Order shall supersede all previous circulars/orders on this 
subject and shall be implemented by all concerned, violation of which shall 
attract penalty under section 11A of the Aircraft Act, 1934.
